intro: Steiractinia sodiroi, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that often display a range of colors, including white, pink, and purple. Steiractinia sodiroi typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
